newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian shares down on nervous sentiment.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian shares down on nervous sentiment.

text.p: Norwegian shares traded in negative territory on Thursday amid nail-biting in the market following a period of bullish sentiment.
Oslo's Total share index closed 0.5 percent off at 1300.86 points in healthy turnover of roughly one billion crowns.
"People are nervous," one dealer said. "No question about it. Share prices will probably not rise much in the near future."
Saga Petroleum was the most traded share at 176 million crowns and fell two percent to 150 crowns.

The Oslo-quoted shares in Scandinavian Airlines System (SAS) closed 2.65 percent higher at 116 crowns. It thus continued to climb the day after the carrier beat market expectations with first-half results.

Shares in offshore services company Awilco ASA closed 4.60 percent up at 91.50 crowns in turnover of 59 million crowns. It rose after an unconfirmed report that the company was planning to merge with Petroleum Geo-Services ASA (PGS).
